Should a second species be studied? A3: Generally, data from adult human volunteers and the supporting nonclinical data (in two species) should be available before pediatric clinical trials are initiated, even when the product is not intended for development in adults. Section XII (12) of ICH M3(R2), Clinical Trials in Pediatric Populations, generally provides recommendations for the situation in which adult clinical trials should precede pediatric trials and indicates that juvenile animal toxicity studies are not considered important to support short-term PK trials in pediatric populations. However, if data from adult humans are not available and the drug will be developed only for pediatric subjects, then this is a case where juvenile animal studies in two species would be appropriate to support pediatric PK trials.
